Row.conInstitution: Department of Environment / Ministry of Agriculture, Rural Development and Environment

Row.rcaRemarks: Cyprus reviewed the Sensitive Areas for discharges from urban waste water treatment plants via the Water Pollution Control (Sensitive Areas for Disposal of Urban Waste Water) Ministerial Decree of 2013 (No. 280/2013). Cyprus defined 1 Sensitive Area for Urban Waste Water Discharge (Polemidia Dam) which is subject to eutrophication and 1 Catchment of Sensitive Area (Catchment of Polemidia).

Cyprus reviewed the Sensitive Areas for discharges from urban waste water treatment plants via the Water Pollution Control (Sensitive Areas for Disposal of Urban Waste Water) Ministerial Decree of 2013 (No. 280/2013). Cyprus defined 1 Sensitive Area for Urban Waste Water Discharge (Polemidia Dam) which is subject to eutrophication and 1 Catchment of Sensitive Area (Catchment of Polemidia).

Row.rcaRelatedSARemark: The catchment of SA is defined as the part of the Garyllis river catchment from the Vati area to Polemidia Dam.The SA is a part of the catchment of SA.

Row.aggChangesComment: A change in the generated load is occurred due to the rapid growth of the tourist industry following the connection to the collecting system of extended and newly constructed hotels within the agglomeration. Both Ayia Napa and Paralimni are the most touristic destinations in Cyprus.

Row.uwwRemarks: The load in p.e. is considered the same as the organic design capacity of the plant. The collecting system is fully completed and connected.
The load in p.e. is considered the same as the organic design capacity of the plant. The collecting system is fully completed and connected.
The load in p.e. is calculated on the basis of the max average weekly load based on the use of 24h flow in combination with the respective 24 hour BOD5 sample.

The discharge is in two clusters of infiltration ponds along Kouris river bed.
The discharge is in a series of infiltration ponds along Ezousa river bed.

With respect to discharge point CY11_6-DisPoint, Pediaios River, it is noted that the water body CY_6_1_4_R3 was removed from the WFD river water body network for the 2nd RBMP because it has an ephemeral/episodic flow regime (river type: ephemeral/episodic flow). Discharge is into a river that is NOT a WFD water body.

With respect to discharge point CY11_5-DisPoint4, Kaloyeros River, it is noted that the water body CY_6-1-5_R3-HM was removed from the WFD river water body network for the 2nd RBMP because it has an ephemeral/episodic flow regime (river type: ephemeral/episodic flow). Discharge is into a river that is NOT a WFD water body.

With respect to discharge point CY11_5-DisPoint5, Athalassa Reservoir, it is noted that the water body CY_6-1-51_R3 was removed from the WFD river water body network for the 2nd RBMP because it has an ephemeral/episodic flow regime (river type: ephemeral/episodic flow). Discharge is into a water reservoir that is NOT a WFD water body.

Row.mslWWReuseExplain: 51,4% irrigation, 27,6% into the dry bed of Pediaios and Serrachis River for infiltration, 16,1% in Ezousa & Akrotiri aquifers, 1,5% in Polemidia Dam for irrigation
Row.mslRemarks: The 5187 t DS/y mentioned in others refers to 4505 t DS/y of sludge tranported for anaerobic treatment for biogas production and to 682 t DS/y of sludge storaged at the plants to be reused.
